H0.text: Pollution can be eliminated through water testing illustrates that scientists frequently monitor levels of microorganisms at beaches in the summer, where high temperatures, pollution, runoff, and illegal dumping all affect water quality.

H1.text: High temperatures increase runoff from agricultural fields, illustrating that scientistsâ€™ monitoring of microorganism levels at beaches during summer shows how high temperatures, pollution, runoff, and illegal dumping all affect water quality.

H2.text: Water testing identifies the origin of illegal dumping by monitoring microorganism levels at beaches during summer, a process affected by high temperatures, pollution, runoff, and illegal dumping.

H3.text: Monitoring water quality is important to public health as illustrated by scientists frequently monitoring levels of microorganisms at beaches in the summer, where high temperatures, pollution, runoff, and illegal dumping affect water quality.

A4.text: The key basic water quality parameters that need to be addressed in an emergency are bacteriological indicators of fecal contamination, free chlorine residual, pH, turbidity and possibly conductivity/total dissolved solids.
